title: Giuseppe Incocciati
text:
Giuseppe Incocciati (born November 16, 1963 in <a href="Fiuggi">Fiuggi</a>) is an Italian professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> coach and a former professional player who played as a <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a>. He is currently the manager of <a href="A.S.D.%20Atletico%20Terme%20Fiuggi">Atletico Terme Fiuggi</a>.
Playing career.
As a player, he played 7 seasons (139 games, 23 goals) in the <a href="Serie%20A">Serie A</a> for <a href="A.C.%20Milan">A.C. Milan</a>, <a href="Atalanta%20B.C.">Atalanta B.C.</a>, <a href="Empoli%20F.C.">Empoli F.C.</a>, <a href="Pisa%20Calcio">Pisa Calcio</a> and <a href="S.S.C.%20Napoli">S.S.C. Napoli</a>.
Managerial career.
After a stint as youth coach of <a href="A.S.%20Cisco%20Calcio%20Roma">Cisco Roma</a>, he was hired as <a href="U.S.%20Avellino%201912">Avellino</a> head coach in 2008 for a short period.
He returned at Cisco Roma the following year, this time as head coach, with whom he won promotion to <a href="Lega%20Pro%20Prima%20Divisione">Lega Pro Prima Divisione</a> by the end of the season. He resigned in April 2011, with the club (now named Atletico Roma) fighting for a promotion playoff spot.
He served as head coach of <a href="A.S.%20Martina%20Franca%201947">Martina Franca</a> in 2015–16.
In July 2019, he was named new head coach of hometown <a href="Serie%20D">Serie D</a> club <a href="A.S.D.%20Atletico%20Terme%20Fiuggi">Atletico Terme Fiuggi</a>.
